dt: {bc}to have no trust or confidence in {bc}{sx|suspect||}
{bc}to doubt the truth, validity, or effectiveness of

dt.t: your mind {wi}mistrusted{/wi} there was something wrong

shortdef: to have no trust or confidence in : suspect
to doubt the truth, validity, or effectiveness of

pt: {sc}uncertainty{/sc} {sc}doubt{/sc} {sc}dubiety{/sc} {sc}skepticism{/sc} {sc}suspicion{/sc} {sc}mistrust{/sc} mean lack of sureness about someone or something. {sc}uncertainty{/sc} may range from a falling short of certainty to an almost complete lack of conviction or knowledge especially about an outcome or result.

pt.t: assumed the role of manager without hesitation or {it}uncertainty{/it}

pt: {sc}doubt{/sc} suggests both uncertainty and inability to make a decision.

pt.t: plagued by {it}doubts{/it} as to what to do

pt: {sc}skepticism{/sc} implies unwillingness to believe without conclusive evidence.
{sc}suspicion{/sc} stresses lack of faith in the truth, reality, fairness, or reliability of something or someone.
{sc}mistrust{/sc} implies a genuine doubt based upon suspicion.
